reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Supporting the Newly IDPs with Free Bread in Dana and Salqin Sub-Districts

description.narrative:
The proposed project aims to improve access to food for 3750 displaced families 3750 HHs, individual 18750 (4500 men, 3000 women, 6750 boys, and 4500 girls) including 375 PWD in Dana, and Salqin sub-districts who are currently living in temporary camps. in Salqin subdistrict, 1330 families in 13 non-formal camps and in Dana sub-district 2450 families in 15 non-formal camps will be targeted.
MWL organization is planning to response to those families through free bread distribution, The process will depend on the following modality:
- Procurement of flour and yeast to be provided to the bakeries for making bread. - Contracting with the baking supplier for baking the bread. - Distributing the bread to the targeted beneficiaries in non-formal settlements in Dana and Salqin sub-districts in the following camps:
Dana Sub-District-Dana Community( Raes Aleen (36°11'45.2"N 36°45'28.7"E), Alnajmeh (36°11'48.5"N 36°46'17.7"E), Al-Rahmeh (36°12'46.0"N 36°46'38.9"E), and Algonud (36°11'40.2"N 36°46'36.6"E)) Dana, Termanin Community (Darraman (36°12'10.1"N 36°49'11.8"E), Ahmed Suaad (36°14'31.5"N 36°48'48.0"E)) Dana,Tilaada Community (Alheer (36°15'27.3"N 36°48'25.6"E), western rural (36°15'32.1"N 36°48'33.1"E), Alghadpha (36°15'34.7"N 36°48'27.5"E), Almuhdathah (36°15'21.9"N 36°48'21.2"E)) Dana, Hezreh – Hezri Commuinty( Hezri cluster(36°14'39.9"N 36°47'15.3"E), Ebaad Al Rahman (36°13'59.2"N 36°47'35.1"E)). Dana, Deir Hassan - Darhashan Community (Alshahen road (36°14'16.0"N 36°45'49.1"E), Al Dreghneha cluster(36°14'09.8"N 36°46'09.6"E), Kuita Cluster(36°13'42.7"N 36°45'10.6"E)).
Salqin Sub-District- Abu Talha Community (Abu Talha (36°06'46.1"N 36°25'56.9"E), Abu Talha school (36°06'12.8"N 36°26'00.9"E)) Salqin, Saidiyeh Community (Haj Jumah (36°04'05.8"N 36°25'32.8"E), Saidiyeh School(36°03'58.2"N 36°25'23.1"E)) Salqin, Salqin Community(Alakademeh (36°08'45.0"N 36°27'28.2"E), Alhal mareket (36°09'08.3"N 36°27'31.9"E), Algameh (36°08'40.8"N 36°26'41.0"E), Alsakan Alshababi (36°08'56.9"N 36°27'39.3"E)) Salqin, Kafr Hind Community(Albayder (36°05'05.7"N 36°26'11.9"E), Beit Alkhteeb (36°04'59.4"N 36°26'11.7"E), Alkhrbeh Camp, Almarabet (36°04'58.1"N 36°25'50.0"E)) Salqin, Allani Community (Allani road (36°07'25.7"N 36°22'21.9"E))
Free bread distribution will be targeting IDPs who are suffering from the poor econimecal situation due to the recent inflation and crisis of lack of breads in north Syria. The targeted IDPs will be selected from people who had left their communities as a result of the latest escalation of hostilities in northern Syria and are being settled in non-formal camps.
Prioritization of the target locations was based on a clear vulnerability selection criterion (women and child-headed HHs pregnant or lactating women, families with high numbers of family members, especially the families with children less than 5 year-old, Household has one or more disabled family members, a household with elderly persons (More than 55 years old), families with no access income, IDPs living in temporary newly random camps.
The bread packs were designed and calculated taking into account person minimum needs (200g/person/day) on the last recommendations of FSL cluster. the pack has been designed to be 800g total weight. so, the project will provide 3750HH with 7000 pack on daily basis. so, families that have 1- 4 members will receive 1 bread pack, the families have 5-8 members will receive 2 packs and the families have 9 and above members will receive 3 bread packs.
the flour and yeast will be provided to the warehouse by the vendors, then it will be transferred by MWL team to bakeries based on supply schedule. In the bakeries, the bread will be made, packaged and prepared for loading. MWL team will distribute the bread from two bakeries to the targeted location to be distributed by distribution team. baking, packaging and distribution process will be monitored by MWL MEAL t
